The effect of lime on the yield and composition of crops and on the status of P and K in soils - Rothamsted (R) Sawyers I and Woburn (j) Stackyard Series C 1962, the first year.

Area of each sub plot: 0.0145 acres. Area harvested: 0.0093 acres.
Treatments. All combinations of:-
Ground chalk: None; 2; 4; 6 tons CaCO, per acre applied in March 1962,
PB: None; 0.5 cwt P, 05 per acre as superphosphate.
Ks None; 1.0 cwt x50 per acre as muriate of potash.
Incculation of seed: None; Inoculated with Rhizobium leguminosarum

Mar 5, 1962, Rotary cultivated: Mar 14. Superphosphate and muriete of potash applied: Mar 15. Seed drilled at 200 lb per acre: Mar 16. Sprayed with simazine at 1 1b in 40 gallons per acre: Apr 11. Sprayed with demeton methyl at 6 fluid oz in 60 gellons per acre: July 6. Combine harvested: Sept 20. Variety: Tick 30B. Previous crops: Potatoes and fellow 1960, potatoes and fallow 1961.
Stackyard Series C (W): Ploughed: Nov 24, 1961. Ground chalk epplied: Mar 9, 1962. Superphosphate and muriate of potash applied: Mar 15. Seed drilled at 200 1b per acre: Mar 19, Sprayed with simazine at 1 1b in 40 gallons per acre: Apr 12. Sprayed with demeton methyl at 6 fluid oz in 60 gellons per acre: July 12. Combine harvested: Sept 20. Variety: Tick 30B.
' Previous crops: Barley 1960, suger beet 1961. Note: Samples were taken for counts of pods and beans. Standard errors per plot.
